availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard T. Lindsay (Harrison Co, Ky, resident)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, resident and merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Caroline Williams Lindsay in Harrison County, Kentucky, on April 23, 1851. Father of Mollie H. Lindsay, Martha B. Lindsay, Jessie B. Lindsay, Sarah Lindsay, Kate Lindsay, Richard Lindsay, and Anna Lindsay. Clerk and Merchant in Lawrence County, Arkansas, in 1860. Resident of Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216887.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Arkansas, Lawrence, Black River, p. 149.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Pettis, Elk Fork, p. 461A.
Find A Grave, "Richard T. Lindsay (1811-1882)," Memorial #22498491, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22498491 (accessed November 15, 2019).
KYR-0001-004-0388.
